intro: Anthistiria desfontainii, commonly known as the African violet. This plant is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. It is often cultivated as a popular ornamental plant due to its compact size and attractive foliage.
